intro: Lycianthes amphidoxys, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshade plants such as tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, violet to blue flowers that bloom in the early morning. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Lycianthes amphidoxys is typically grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive flowers and relatively easy cultivation requirements.
